text: Albert "Tootie" Heath (May 31, 1935 â€“ April 3, 2024) was an American jazz hard bop drummer. He is the brother of saxophonist Jimmy Heath and the bassist Percy Heath. In 1975, the brothers formed the Heath Brothers. He notably worked with musicians such as John Coltrane, J. J. Johnson, Wes Montgomery, Art Farmer and Benny Golson's Jazztet, Cedar Walton, Bobby Timmons, Kenny Drew, Sonny Rollins, Dexter Gordon, Johnny Griffin, Herbie Hancock, Friedrich Gulda, Nina Simone and Yusef Lateef. Heath was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Heath died from leukemia in Santa Fe, New Mexico, on April 3, 2024, at the age of 88. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2024 deaths Category:African-American musicians Category:American drummers Category:American jazz musicians Category:Musicians from Philadelphia Category:Deaths from leukemia
title: Albert Heath
